intro: Haplophyllum propinquum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hollyhock, is a perennial herb native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a hairy underside and produces showy, pink to purple flowers in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species in its native environment.
